00019 class TClonesArray; 
00020 class EdwHLASambaSubRecord;
00021 class EdwHLASingleBoloSubRecord;

00028 const Char_t kHLAEventName[] = "HLA";
00029 const Char_t kHLAClassName[] = "EdwHLAEvent";
00030 
00031 class EdwHLAEvent : public EdwEventBase {         
00032         
00033 public:
00034         //Constructors and destructor. Only Derived class and the Factory
00035         //SHOULD access these methods. 
00036         //However, in order for ROOT's I/O to work properly
00037         //the constructor and destructor
00038         //have to be public. Otherwise, I would have made them protected or private
00039         EdwHLAEvent(void);
00040         EdwHLAEvent(const EdwHLAEvent &anEvent);
00041         virtual ~EdwHLAEvent(void);
00042         EdwHLAEvent& operator=(const EdwEventBase &anEvent);
00043         EdwHLAEvent& operator=(const EdwRawEvent &anEvent);
00044         EdwHLAEvent& operator=(const EdwHLAEvent &anEvent);
00045         virtual void Clear(Option_t *option = "C");
00046         Bool_t IsSame(const EdwHLAEvent &anEvent, Bool_t bPrint = false) const;
00047         Bool_t operator==(const EdwHLAEvent &anEvent) const { return IsSame(anEvent,false); }
00048         Bool_t operator!=(const EdwHLAEvent &anEvent) const { return !(*this==anEvent); }
00049         virtual void Compact(void);
00050         
00051         //Easy Access Methods
00052         //These methods access commonly requested quantities without
00053         //having to dig down into the branch structure.
00054         //Double_t GetBoloEventEnergy(void);
00055         //Int_t GetNumberBoloHits(void);
00056         
00057         //Getters and Setters to member variables
00058         Bool_t TestDataCleaningBit(Int_t i) const {return fDataCleaningWord.TestBitNumber(i);}
00059         //Bool_t TestDataCleaningWord(Int_t aWord); //this does a bit-wise comparison
00060         
00061         Int_t GetNumSambas(void) const {return fNumSamba;}
00062         Int_t GetNumBolos(void) const {return fNumBolo;}
00063         Int_t GetNumBoloPulses(void) const {return fNumBoloPulse;} 
00064         Int_t GetNumMuonModules(void) const {return fNumMuonModule;} 
00065         
00066         //system record pointers
00067         EdwHLABoloSysRecord* GetBoloSystemRecord(void) {return &fBoloSystem;}
00068         EdwHLAMuonVetoSysRecord* GetMuonVetoSystemRecord(void) {return &fMuonSystem;}
00069         //EdwHLANCSysRecord* GetHLANCSysRecord(void) {return &fEdwHLANCSysRecord;}
00070         
00071         EdwHLASambaSubRecord* GetSamba(Int_t i) const;
00072         EdwHLASingleBoloSubRecord* GetBolo(Int_t i) const;
00073         EdwHLABoloPulseSubRecord* GetBoloPulse(Int_t i) const;
00074         EdwHLAMuonModuleSubRecord* GetMuonModule(Int_t i) const;
00075         
00076         //pointers to TClonesArrays of SubRecord objects. 
00077         //unless you need some specific informaton from the TClonesArray
00078         //its best to use the methods above to get pointers
00079         //directly to the subRecords
00080         TClonesArray* GetSambaSubRecords(void) const {return fSamba;}
00081         TClonesArray* GetBoloSubRecords(void) const {return fBolo;}
00082         TClonesArray* GetBoloPulseSubRecords(void) const {return fBoloPulse;}
00083         TClonesArray* GetMuonModuleSubRecords(void) const {return fMuonModule;}
00084         
00085         //Adders
00086         EdwHLASambaSubRecord* AddSamba();
00087         EdwHLASingleBoloSubRecord* AddBolo();
00088         EdwHLABoloPulseSubRecord* AddBoloPulse();
00089         EdwHLAMuonModuleSubRecord* AddMuonModule();
00090         
00091         //Remove
00092         //RemoveSamba(Int_t i);
00093         //RemoveBolo(Int_t i);
00094         //RemoveBoloPulse(Int_t i);
00095         //RemoveMuonModule(Int_t i);
00096         
00097         //Setters to local members
00098         void SetDataCleaningBit(Int_t i, Bool_t val = true) {fDataCleaningWord.SetBitNumber(i,val);}
00099                 
00100         //Only use these if you know what you're doing. 
00101         void SetNumSamba(Int_t aNum){fNumSamba = aNum;}
00102         void SetNumBolo(Int_t aNum){fNumBolo = aNum;}
00103         void SetNumBoloPulse(Int_t aNum){fNumBoloPulse = aNum;}
00104         void SetNumMuonModule(Int_t aNum){fNumMuonModule = aNum;}
00105         
00106         //Print data members //Probably it would be much easier to implement it in EventBase and just overload it, but I don't really know how to do it and I only really nead it for testing.
00107         void myPrint();
00108         
00109 private: 
00110 
00111         TBits fDataCleaningWord;  //each bit in this word represents the pass/fail of this event to specific data cleaning cuts
00112 
00113         EdwHLABoloSysRecord fBoloSystem;  //use short names here so that its easier to read the tree
00114         EdwHLAMuonVetoSysRecord fMuonSystem; //useshort names here so that its easier to read the tree
00115         //EdwHLANCSysRecord fncS;
00116         
00117         //Array of SubRecords containing event information
00118         Int_t fNumSamba; //    //the //! tells the ROOT streamer not to include this. We don't need it since we could get the size from the TObjArray itself.
00119         Int_t fNumBolo; //  
00120         Int_t fNumBoloPulse; //
00121         Int_t fNumMuonModule; //
00122         //we don't need to store these values in the tree. There are two ways
00123         //a user can determine the number of these records in the event.
00124         //1) - from a root script that calls Event::GetNumSamba, etc...
00125         //2) - from the TTree selections of
00126         //         @fSamba.size()>0
00127         //         @fBolo.size()>0
00128         //         @fBoloPulse.size()>0
00129         //         @fMuModlue.size()>0
00130         // For example root [0] TFile f("EDSRunFile.root");
00131         //             root [1] t->Scan("*","@fBolo.size()==1");
00132         // selects all of the events where there is only one bolometer
00133         // with a record in the event. Now.. this doesn't (YET?) guarantee
00134         // that only one Bolometer in the event has a real physics event
00135         // it only tells you the number of records in the data structure
00136         
00137         TClonesArray *fSamba; //->  //use short names here
00138         TClonesArray *fBolo; //->  // use short names here
00139         TClonesArray *fBoloPulse;  //->
00140         TClonesArray *fMuonModule; //->
00141         
00142         /*NOTE - I am using short names here in order to improve the readability
00143          of the TTree when looking at the file from the TBrowser or from
00144          the TTree::Show TTree::Scan methods. 
00145          
00146          ALSO, the names of the system record class and the TClonesArrays
00147          should be EXACTLY the same as the names used in ALL Other Event Levels, 
00148          such as the Raw level and the MC level. This makes it easy for porting
00149          analysis code for each level... 
00150          
00151          In principle, everybody doing analysis should use each Class's Member 
00152          Functions, rather than directly reading from the TTree. This ensures 
00153          that the data in the TTrees are properly encapsulated and the user 
00154          doesn't NEED to know the structure or the names of the underlying 
00155          TTree.... This is especially important if the underlying data 
00156          structure changes! By using member functions in a ROOT script or 
00157          compiled code, you're no longer dependent upon the exact naming 
00158          structure in your analysis. 
00159          But, since many people are still uncomfortable with C++
00160          and many people are still doing their 
00161          analysis by direct interaction with the data Tree, we will support 
00162          them as much as possible by using these easy-to-read names that 
00163          are the same accross the different "levels".
00164          
00165          */
00166         
00167         //private methods
00168         template<class T> T* AddSubRecord(TClonesArray *mArray, Int_t &mCount);
00169         void ClearArray(Option_t *anOpt, TClonesArray *mArray, Int_t &mCount);
00170         void CreateArrays(void);
00171         void InitializeMembers(void);
00172         void CopyLocalMembers(const EdwHLAEvent &anEvent);
00173         void CopyClonesArrays(const EdwHLAEvent &anEvent);
00174         void CopyFromRawEvent(const EdwRawEvent &anEvent);
00175         
00176         ClassDef(EdwHLAEvent ,1);
00177 };
